```{r, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(shiny)
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
library(ggplot2)
library(readr)
library(viridis)
library(bslib)


# get data
shows <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nbrigida1/Series-Ratings-Visualization/refs/heads/main/imdb_top_250_series_episode_ratings.csv")  %>%
   mutate(
     Season = as.numeric(Season),
     Episode = as.numeric(Episode),
     Rating = as.numeric(Rating)
   )

# get name of each series uniquely for dropdown input
series <- shows %>%
  distinct(Title) %>% 
  pull(Title) %>%
  na.omit()

#ratings plot
ratings_plot <- function(df, by_seasons) { 
  
  df <- df %>% #Edge case where episode has multiple ratings for some reason
  group_by(Season, Episode) %>% 
  summarise(Rating = mean(Rating, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop") 
  if(by_seasons){
    plot = ggplot(df, aes(x = Episode, y = Rating, color = Rating)) +
      geom_line(show.legend = FALSE, size= 3) +
      geom_point(size = 5, show.legend = F) +
      facet_wrap(~ Season, labeller = labeller(Season = function(x) paste("Season", x))) + #labeler lets me title each faceted plot
      theme_minimal() +
      labs(title = "Ratings by Episode", x = "Episode", y = "Rating") +
      scale_x_continuous() + 
      scale_y_continuous(breaks = seq(0,10, by = .5), labels = seq(0,10, by = .5)) +  
      #scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 10), labels = 0:10, breaks = 0:10) +
      scale_color_gradient2(high = "#83bcff", low = "#A8D26D", mid = "#5CB270", midpoint = 8.5) #colors to denote high performing episodes in blue and lower performing ones in dark green
  }else{ 
    df <- df %>% #make episodes sequential instead of by season
      arrange(Season, Episode) %>% #first order them in the arrange
      mutate(Episode = row_number()) #the actual episode number should be the row number now
    #same plot but without faceting
    plot = ggplot(df, aes(x = Episode, y = Rating, color = Rating)) +
      geom_line(show.legend = FALSE, size= 3) +
      geom_point(size = 5, show.legend = F) +
      theme_minimal() +
      labs(title = "Ratings by Episode", x = "Episode", y = "Rating") +
      scale_x_continuous() + 
      scale_y_continuous(breaks = seq(0,10, by = .5), labels = seq(0,10, by = .5)) +  
      scale_color_gradient2(high = "#83bcff", low = "#A8D26D", mid = "#5CB270", midpoint = 8.5)
  }
  
plot
}



#bar plot
average_ratings_plot <- function(df, labels, by_seasons) {
if(by_seasons){
    avg_ratings <- df %>%
      group_by(Season) %>% #average ratings by season
      summarize(Average_Rating = mean(Rating, na.rm = TRUE)) 
    
    #simple bar plot of ratings values
  plot =  ggplot(avg_ratings, aes(x = factor(Season), y = Average_Rating, fill = Average_Rating)) +
    geom_bar(stat = "identity", show.legend = FALSE, width = 0.5) + 
    theme_minimal() +
    labs(title = "Average Ratings by Season", x = "Season", y = "Average Rating") +
    scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 10), labels = 0:10, breaks = 0:10) +
    scale_x_discrete(breaks = 0:10, labels = 0:10) + 
    scale_fill_gradient2(low = "red", mid = "#E0F752", high = "#009933", 
                     midpoint = 7.5, limits = c(5, 10))
  #show high performing episodes in dark green, average in yellow, poor in red

  
  
} else {
  #same plot but with different legend and collapse bars into one
  avg_ratings <- df %>%
      group_by(Title) %>%
      summarize(Average_Rating = mean(Rating, na.rm = TRUE)) 
    
  plot =  ggplot(avg_ratings, aes(x = Title, y = Average_Rating, fill = Average_Rating)) +
    geom_bar(stat = "identity", show.legend = FALSE, width = 0.5) +
    theme_minimal() +
    labs(title = "Average Rating Over All Seasons", x = "Show", y = "Average Rating") +
    scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 10), labels = 0:10, breaks = 0:10) +
    scale_x_discrete() + 
    scale_fill_gradient2(low = "red", mid = "#E0F752", high = "#009933", 
                     midpoint = 7.5, limits = c(5, 10))

}

#add labels to bar plot if option is selected
if (labels) {
      plot <- plot + 
        geom_text(aes(label = round(Average_Rating, 2)),  
              vjust = -0.5,  
              size = 5, fontface = "bold")
}
  
plot 
}



ui <- page_sidebar(
  title = titlePanel("IMDB Series Ratings"),
  sidebar = sidebar(
    helpText("Select a TV series to visualize its IMDb ratings."),
    selectInput("series", "Series", series),
    helpText("Choose whether you would like seperate visualizations for each season or one visualization of all seasons"),
    radioButtons(
        "by_seasons",
        "Season Grouping",
        choices = list("By Season" = T, "Combined" = F),
        selected = T
      ),
    helpText("Choose if you would like precise labels denoting average season ratings"),
  checkboxInput("labels", "Bar Plot Labels", value = T),
  ""
    ),
  card(
    card_header("Plots"),
    plotOutput("ratings_scatter"),
    plotOutput("average_ratings_bar")
  )
)
  

server <- function(input, output) {
  movies_subset <- reactive({
    shows %>%
      filter(Title == input$series)
  })
  
  output$ratings_scatter <- renderPlot({
    ratings_plot(movies_subset() ,input$by_seasons)
  })
  
  output$average_ratings_bar <- renderPlot({
    average_ratings_plot(movies_subset(), input$labels, input$by_seasons)
  })
}

app <- shinyApp(ui, server)
app
```
